intro: Desmopsis brachypoda, commonly known as the narrowleaf desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
